headline: Fried Chicken Tenders
description: Enjoy this fried chicken tenders recipe that makes crispy, delicious chicken pieces and features an easy, spicy horseradish sauce for dipping.

video.description: See how to make tender breaded chicken fingers with dipping sauce.
video.name: Fried Chicken Tenders

name: Fried Chicken Tenders

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the breading station: Place flour in a shallow bowl. Place eggs and water in a second shallow bowl. Place bread crumbs in a third shallow bowl, and mix in ground black pepper and cayenne pepper.
Coat chicken in flour, then eggs, and then bread crumbs, one piece at a time, and set aside.
Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Fry chicken in small batches until the pieces are golden brown, 6 to 8 minutes. Remove chicken to drain on paper towels or a wire rack.
Make the dipping sauce: Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, horseradish, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce in a small bowl. Mix well, and serve with chicken.

review.reviewBody: I put some garlic salt in the bread crumbs and it was delicious! Fairly simple but good recipe.
Love the extra crispness the bread crumbs add... food lion makes a soulfood seasoning that makes the flavor irresistible. This is definitely an easy and quick staple meal for my family.
I made it EXACTLY LIKE THE RECIPE!!

Great recipe! Deep fried the fresh-cut chicken strips at closer to 350 than 375 (the first few were too done) and 5-minutes was perfect. Super easy and good. Everybody from Grandma to the kids liked them!
exceptionally delicious! will def make this recipe again.

This was delicious! Made this today with modifications. Took the advice of others and I seasoned the chicken itself using Lawry’s Seasoning Salt, Garlic Powder, Black Pepper and Red Pepper Flakes. I smothered chicken breasts in mayo, then refrigerated and allowed it to marinate for a few hours. I then floured, dipped in eggs (used heavy whipping cream instead of water), then the bread crumbs and pan fried in the stove. VERY juicy and tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. Would definitely make this again. I loved it!!!
Nice and semi-crispy outside, tender inside + some kick! I’m a fan:)! Thanks!
Used 2 TB of mustard and horseradish (instead of 3) and it was my kind of flavor!
I added more cayenne was awesome.
This recipe was amazing and delicious I can make this like a million times and never get tired of it!!!! I made it for my family and they just devoured it
My family Love these!!! They are great!
Really needed more seasoning. I added garlic powder, onion powder and kosher salt. Hubby liked (always a good sign).

I used gluten-free flour and gluten-free bread crumbs. Didn't put enough spice in it. Needs at least 3 if not 4 eggs, not the 2 listed.
.
Cut breasts into fingers.
Drop chicken into flour. Coat well.
Drop into eggs. Coat all sides.
Place on breadcrumbs, then pour additional breadcrumbs over the top to coat.

I think this is a great, super easy recipe that picky people of all ages will enjoy. My only complaint is that I wish there was more flavor to the recipe. My boyfriend and I felt it was a little bland. Next time I make this recipe I will definitely be adding for seasoning.
I have made this before and it is an easy and quick meal. I add extra worchestershire and horseradish to the dipping sauce, because we like spicy foods.
Easy and tasty.
The only change I made to the recipe is frying in a large, deep, cast-iron skillet with coconut oil, ghee, and vegetable oil.
The only change I made to the recipe is frying in a large, deep, cast-iron skillet with coconut oil, ghee, and vegetable oil.
i will make this recipe at home

Texture wise - these are perfect. Crunchy and juicy. Definitely lacks flavor though and is rather bland (the reason for 4 stars) .

I will most definitely make these again but I will add additional seasoning, maybe salt and garlic powder as others suggested .
very good we'll have this again
The flavor was bland and I will not make it again

Made this for my fiancé’s kids who don’t like sauces so I added a little garlic and onion powder (1 1/2tsp of each)to the flour mix. The pickiest kid I’ve ever met called these the best chicken strips he’s ever had!
I used a deep fryer and they turned out delicious.. Will definitely be making these again..

This is the best fried chicken tender recipe I've found. The only change I made was with the dipping sauce. I only use the mayonnaise, sour cream, and Worcestershire sauce (I'm not a horseradish person). So good.
I used Tony chacere seasoning and an extra egg. They came out great.
Simply delicious!! We will make it 1,000,000,000.... times more.
Awesome recipe tasty and tender
Very good recipe! I didn't have the ingredients for the sauce, but I plan to try it next time. I don't have a deep fryer, so I just pan fried them in vegetable oil. Delicious!

Tried this out on a whim. My fiance loved it and so did I. We ate 2nds and 3rds it was so good. 
I didn't use cayenne pepper or turmeric but used curry powder instead. Also made a batch with rolled oats instead of breadcrumbs - quite tastey indeed. Juicy and succulent
Turned out so Awesome !!!!!!

This was a great basic recipe! I didn't have bread crumbs or panko, but I did have some leftover cornflakes and they worked great. I wasn't crazy about the sauce. Kind of bland in my opinion, so will have to read up to see if anyone made any changes. Family loved it!

Added grated Parmesan to bread
Crumbs also salt and garlic powder. Was delicious. The sauce
Was also an added bonus especially if chicken is a little dry.
Will definitely cook this dish again.
Super easy!! The recipe does not call for seasoning salt so I completely didn't think of adding. Still very good and my mistake.
Nice and quick.....taste better than any take out.

Tenders were great. Good breading and flavor. Cook times at 375 in a deep frier were only 4 mins so that was way off. The sauce I found to be bland. Next time I'll use a Chipotle ranch dressing. Based on bland sauce and inaccurate cook times, I gave it a 3.

Tasted good, the only difference I made was using Italian seasoned Panko bread crumbs.

One star removed for cooking time in recipe - 375 degrees in my deep fryer only took 3 minutes, not 6-8, which caused the first batch to be WAY overcooked and almost burnt.

These are better than the local, popular chicken chain. The filet's are tender and delicious. Use your thermometer and be sure to not overcook. We liked the breading but would use 3 times the Cayenne next time. The dipping sauce was ok but a little too tangy for us with 3 T mustard. I'll stick with homemade ranch next time.

This recipe is my mainstay for "Fun Food Night" and picnic time. Not very caloric and the horseradish dip was the best. One change. I used lowfat yoghurt for instead of mayo for the dip, eliminated the sour creme and used lemon juice instead. Next time, I'll include a bit of the sour creme. I also didn't deep fry–didn't need to, the shallow skillet was fine.

Loved it!! It was crispy and juicy, very delicious. It was even approved by my picky 4 year old which doesn't like anything good lol I didn't make the dipping sauce but I'll will try it next time for sure. Thanks for sharing it.
I followed direction precisely. The bread crumbs were scorched before the inside of the chicken was done. I cooked more dipping it twice in flour with no bread crumbs, and it turned out much better.
Super good!!

I didn't really care for it. I added extra spices, whatever I had in the kitchen but the breading was too hard. I switched from the deep fryer to the cast iron skillet so I was able to control the browning a little better. I wanted something with a crunchier crust but the wasn't it. It's ok though and since I didn't make the dip to go with it, it's probably my fault :)
definitely will be making this again! love the coating!
I was out of red pepper, so I used cajun seasoning and it came out great! To save time, I used Thai sweet chili sauce for the dip, and my kids enjoyed it with barbecue sauce.
Super juicy and the flavor of chicken is great!!! Going to try dip another time.
Will make again, just as ls . No changes

Really good, crispy outside and tender inside. I did however first marinate the tenderloins in salted water to which I added hot sauce and red pepper flakes. That sat for about 4 hours, then I let them dry on paper towels. This adds flavor to the chicken itself. Dish cooks up fast and stays nicely in a warm oven. Rave reviews from my picky eaters!!
Very good, easy and I love the dipping sauce!
It was amazing! I will definitely make this again.

These are very good and really are quick to make. I used chicken breast cut in strips and my bad, didn't read the recipe fully and mixed the flour and the crumbs together - it worked out fine. Might add some more spices next time, slightly on the bland side but they were crunchy and good. We used our own sauces so can't judge the horseradish sauce but will try it next time.

really delicious! It looked like they were cooking too long in the oil for 6 minutes, but I waited for six minutes and they came out beautiful and juicy. I didn't use the sauce, since I didn't have the ingredients required on hand, so I used buffalo wing sauce.

I gave this a 5 stars, because it was good. The only issue is that the cooking time is way too long if you have a regular chicken breast sliced into tenders. 2 min 30 sec to maybe 3 mins is probably the longest cook time at 375.

The dipping sauce was good, but the chicken fingers were very bland, even with the addition of more cayenne and some garlic salt. Next time I'll either marinate or at least salt & pepper the chicken first.

Amazing recipe! I followed directions & used the ingredients listed except I went with 1\4 tsp cayenne to keep the heat minimal so it wasn't too spicy for my 8 & 9 year old daughters, I used panko bread crumbs & pan fried my family loved dinner & after having 2nds & 3rds they brought me empty plates with smiles & full bellies.....haven't made the sauce we use BBQ but honestly the chicken is even awesome w\o sauce...

I loved this recipe. I will for sure make it again. They were really tender and easy for a beginner cook like me. I really don't like to cook but I'm in need of a variety of dinner ideas so I wanted to try this recipe based on reviews. Excellent! Next time I think I'd add a bit more salt cuz I like my tenders with a bit of saltiness. I also pounded my chicken to try and make it all equal size so I wouldn't burn it like I've done so often.

We will make it again. We did not use a deep fryer but a cast iron skillet then put it in the oven to crisp it up. It needs more salt and pepper for flavor. Overall, we will make it again, but will play around with the seasoning.
dipping sauce is alot but good

I didn't make the dipping sauce as it doesn't appeal to our tastes. By themselves I found them a bit bland. My boys just dip it in ketchup anyway and I found some sweet/sour from McDonalds! Anything that my picky kids will eat is ok by me!
Perfect! Had to make my own breadcrumbs but it still turned out great. Whole family loved it.
Follow the recipes for the chicken and it comes out so juicy and delicious! Thx for sharing!
I loved this...added some paprika to the top of the chicken tenders before baking at 350 for 30 minutes...we don't fry much at my house....the dip was a hit with everyone.
Just made this dish, chicken was good but the dipping sauce is the bomb.
Horrible. I set my deep fryer to 375. The chicken burned within 2-3 minutes. I turned the heat down to 350. The outside cooks okay in 6-8 minutes but then the inside was raw.

made these for my family tonight and we all just loved them. Used my electric skillet set on 4oo, 3 min. each side. So juicy on the inside and wonderfully crispy outside. Only thing I changed; I used Pepperidge Farm Herb seasoned stuffing after crushing. Just because I had it in pantry. It was the perfect blend of seasoning for chicken. Great Recipe. Thanks for sharing
Made this recipe for dinner, there was too much bread crumbs and the chicken was bland, even with cayenne pepper. The family gave dinner a 2.
Replaced bread crumbs w/Panko. Really crispy and good.

Love the recipe I cooked mine 5 min 30 sec and they are juicy and tender . I used filtered grease so they do appear darker. Also I used blue cheese and sweet baby rays for dip. I'm going to try the the sauce next time . 5 stars.
Very good, although I would add salt.
So easy and so good! My kids ate them all!

Awesome recipe!! i rinsed the checken then Rubbed on some paprika and sprinkled a bit of salt and it came out great!! To make about 10 strips you only need a cup of the Italian bread crumbs. It was delicious! I used a frying pan and added enough oil to cover each chicken strip on about med-high heat. It fried quickly and it was delicious. The breading did fall off a bit when we ate it though.

I made the chicken tenders with horseradish dipping sauce for my husband and son,all they could do was rave about it. Its sooooo good. I will always use this recipe. When hubbys happy everyones happy. Excellent
Tastes good, bit bland needs more spice.

We only had 6 chicken tenders, so the original breading and sauce was too much. I halved the ingredients, and I could have even made a third of it and been okay.
I added 1 Tablespoon of Honey to the sauce, and it added a nice light sweetness to it. This sauce seems like it would be good on hamburgers too.

They were very very good and easy. My 18 year old autistic son made for a school cooking assignment. Will probably pan fry w less oil next time. Can you bake them? He is not a sauce person so we did not make that and limited the spice. I like this site.

I made this incredible recipe in a pan with vegetable oil about 2 inches deep. It turned out incredible and not greasy at all! The sauce was good. I also used crushed Cheez-Its instead of breadcrumbs since I didn't have any and it was deliciously crunchy and flavorful and juicy!!! You can definitely taste the black pepper and cayenne but it's not overpowering, it's amazing!!!
Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly. Did add a touch bit more of Worcestershire sauce and horseradish. We loved the sauce. The sauce truly makes this dish. Thank you submitter.
My family loved this recipe. Everyone ever loved the sauce which was a big surprise for me. My kids want me to make it again.
I personally would like more spicy...but they are great...do you think they would be ok in the oven???? I want to do them in the oven rather than oil...
much better than frying in a pan good crust loved them might add a little more spices to the bread crumbs

delicious! very flavorful despite the low amount of ingredients. used paprika instead of cayenne because we're wusses when it comes to spicy, and added a little italian seasoning and garlic powder. was really good! picky fiance loved it. didn't expect them to be that crispy; just gotta make sure the oil is really hot.

Was not very tasty.
And not sure what happened but 8-10 min chicken was raw.
Shrug..
Very easy to make. The family loved them!
This was great. The whole family loved it! It doesn't take 1 hour either :)

I do not like horseradish so i omitted that ingredient and I added a 1/2 tsp of chicken seasoning along with the spices called for in this recipe. It is delightful. I baked mine in the oven and it came out just as good as fried only I used no skin chicken breasts. I plan to make this again and more often from now on.

Simple easy fried chicken. I didn't bother with the dipping sauce, we are not much for sauces. And I did a splash of milk instead of water but it was FANTASTIC! Delicious, juicy and quick. Also I used a wok to fry them up.

Recipe was easy to do...BF loved it.. and the sauce was good too.. im not a big fan of horseradish but it was good, although maybe next time ill not put in the whole amount of horseradish recipe says... will do again...
These are so good and i have made them twice this week already along with (yummy honey mustard dipping sauce) from this site. They are really easy to make and cook. Thank you Linda

This recipe is awesome!
The only thing I did differently was I used mayo with a little milk to dredge the chicken instead of egg.
Very Good Tenders ! As stated, I pan fried with no problem. THe sauce is Delish !
We didn't like the horseradish sauce at all, but this recipe made the most tender and crispy chicken strips I've ever had. Delightful!
We Loved this recipe! Dont change a thing!

I have always loved fried chicken tenders and this is the perfect recipe!!! - some quick help tips are, you dont have to use tenders, you can use chicken breasts, boneless or debone at home (deboning your own saves $$ and thats all tenders are, the "filet" cut of the breast thats been deboned and they charge an arm and a leg for) then cut into strips. put flour in a zip lock shake a few pieces at a time, lay them out and when done then dip in egg and -- italian bread crumbs are great, but if you're out: try crushed corn flakes, ritz crakers, saltines and my favorite, croutons and put those in a zip lock as well shaking just a piece or two at a time to cover. lastly, for those of us who dont trust deep fryers, you can use a skillet - but to make a bit less greasy and this will work for your deep fryers too- put tray of breaded tenders in the refrigerator for 1/2 an hour or so, get them a bit cold. I also use a mesh splatter cover on my skillet - by the way.... this way makes great regular ol' Fried chicken too!
subbed buttermilk for the water. Dipping sauce is mmmmmmmm!
Have not tried it, was wondering if instead of frying them, it could be done in the oven and eliminate some of the calories from the oil.
These were good and the only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is cuz they just needed to be seasoned more...however that is also up to the individual who is the cook !!

I suppose if you wanted to completely obliterate the taste of the chicken you could add more spices but, as is, the recipe is delicious. Prep is really quite simple. I cut up 2 large B/S breasts to add to the package of tenders to make up the 24 pieces and after putting the flour into a brown paper bag, added the chicken tenders, closed the bag and shook it until all pieces were lightly coated. Proceeded from there to egg wash and then bread crumbs. Frying a few pieces at a time ensures the oil will remain at temp and all pieces will come out crispy. I made the sauce early in the day while chicken was thawing. I can see using that same sauce with chicken wings. We loved it and I'm certain this will be an encore presentation! Thank you for a great recipe!!

I have made homemade chicken fingers for quite a while. My only suggestion...if you're looking for REALLY flavorful chicken fingers...use the pre-seasoned chicken tenders. They are not as inexpensive as regular boneless chicken breasts, but, they impart a wonderful flavor in the chicjen fingers.

Love it!!! Came out amazing. I used hot chili pepper instead of cayenne pepper. Tasted really good just with ketchup. I don't have a deep frier so I used a regular pan with a lot less oil (about 1/2) and I was completely satisfied.
